16:26 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
16:38 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
16:42 <acotiuga> Hello! I have a question regarding methods' deprecation in Java. Let's say I have methodA(String, String) and I figure out that 1 parameter is useless, then I will create methodA(String) and deprecate the first one. Q: Should I replace all the content with a call to the second one, or should I let it as it is?  
16:47 <acotiuga> I saw a lot of examples where the deprecated method contains just a call to the new one, but I saw also one example where the code is not changed when the method is deprecated.  
17:15 <OSIMasson2> has joined #xwiki  
17:16 <OSIMasson1> has quit  
17:18 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
17:43 <evalica> has quit  
17:44 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
17:46 <tmortagne> acotiuga: depends what is the difference between the two method  
17:47 <tmortagne> what is important is that methodA(String, String) does not change  
17:47 <tmortagne> then no duplication when possible is just common sense  
17:47 <tmortagne> s/does not change/behavior does not change/
